title: HTML Introduction
gp1: HTML is the standard markup language for creating Web pages.
gp2: HTML stands for Hyper Text Markup Language
gp3: HTML is the standard markup language for creating Web pages
gp4: HTML describes the structure of a Web page
gp5: HTML consists of a series of elements
gp6: HTML elements tell the browser how to display the content
gp7: HTML elements label pieces of content such as 'this is a heading', 'this is a paragraph', 'this is a link', etc.
wp1: The <!DOCTYPE html> declaration defines that this document is an HTML5 document
wp2: The <html> element is the root element of an HTML page
wp3: The <head> element contains meta information about the HTML page
wp4: The <title> element specifies a title for the HTML page (which is shown in the browser's title bar or in the page's tab)
wp5: The <body> element defines the document's body, and is a container for all the visible contents, such as headings, paragraphs, images, hyperlinks, tables, lists, etc.
wp6: The <h1> element defines a large heading
example:
This is a Heading

This is a paragraph.
